remarks.para: IDockListContainer contains a list of DockPane objects for nested docking. It maintans two lists: and . DockList contains all DockPane objects, no matter it's visible or not; DisplayingDockList contains only visible DockPane objects for this container.
Internally, IDockListContainer creates DockList, this DockList then creates DisplayingDockList, and these two lists are always synchronized.

Property.name: DisplayingList
Property.summary: Gets the which contains a list of visible nested docking objects.
Property.value: The which contains a list of visible nested docking objects.

Property.name: DisplayingRectangle
Property.summary: Gets the rectangle represents the displaying area for nested docking DockPane objects.
Property.value: A represents the displaying area for nested docking DockPane objects.

Property.name: DockList
Property.summary: Gets the which contains a list of nested docking objects.
Property.value: The which contains a list of nested docking objects.

Property.name: DockState
Property.summary: Gets the docking state of this container.

Property.name: IsDisposed
Property.summary: Gets a value indicates the control has been disposed of.
Property.value: True if the control has been disposed of, otherwise, false.

Property.name: IsFloat
Property.summary: Determines if this container window is floating.
Property.value: True if is floating; otherwise, false.
